jsoul.midi

Class Track

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsoul.midi.Track
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Playable

    public class Track
extends java.lang.Object
implements Playable
    Represents a MIDI track, containing a sequence of notes and Chords, as well as an instrument.
    Author:
    Andrew Goldin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Track()
      Default constructor: An empty piano track.
      Track(Playable... p)
      Creates a new track with the given sequence of Playables.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Playable p)
      Adds a new Playable to the track by appending it to the end.
      void clear()
      Clears the track, removing all elements and resets the instrument to default piano.
      Playable getElement(int n)
      Gets the Playable (note or chord) at the given position in the track.
      Playable[] getElements()
      Returns the full list of Playables (Notes and Chords) in the track.
      Instrument getInstrument()
      Gets this track's instrument.
      int getNumElements()
      Gets the number of elements (notes and chords) in the track.
      void remove(int index)
      Removes the Note or Chord at the specified location in the track.
      void set(int index, Playable p)
      Set the Note or Chord at a certain location in the track.
      void setInstrument(Instrument inst)
      Sets the track's instrument using an Instrument object.
      void setInstrument(int instNum)
      Sets the track's instrument using the instrument's MIDI value (0-127).
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the track, including the number of elements, instrument, and the String representation of each element.
      void transpose(int steps)
      Transposes all notes and chords in the track.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Track

        public Track()
        Default constructor: An empty piano track.

      • Track

        public Track(Playable... p)
        Creates a new track with the given sequence of Playables. The playables can be Notes, Chords, or other Tracks. Whole Sequences cannot be added to a track. The track will be built in the order that the Playables are provided.
        Parameters:
        p - the list of Playables

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Playable p)
        Adds a new Playable to the track by appending it to the end. Providing a Sequence will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        p - the playable to add (can only be a Note, Chord, or Track)

      • set

        public void set(int index,
       Playable p)
        Set the Note or Chord at a certain location in the track. If anything other than a Note or a Chord is provided, nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        index - the location of the Note or Chord to set.
        p - the new Playable. Can only be a Note or a Chord.

      • remove

        public void remove(int index)
        Removes the Note or Chord at the specified location in the track.
        Parameters:
        index - the location of the Note or Chord to remove.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the track, removing all elements and resets the instrument to default piano.

      • getNumElements

        public int getNumElements()
        Gets the number of elements (notes and chords) in the track.
        Returns:
        the number of notes and chords.

      • getElements

        public Playable[] getElements()
        Returns the full list of Playables (Notes and Chords) in the track.
        Returns:
        the list of Playables.

      • getElement

        public Playable getElement(int n)
        Gets the Playable (note or chord) at the given position in the track.
        Parameters:
        n - the position of the Playable
        Returns:
        the Playable at position n

      • setInstrument

        public void setInstrument(Instrument inst)
        Sets the track's instrument using an Instrument object.
        Parameters:
        inst - the provided Instrument

      • setInstrument

        public void setInstrument(int instNum)
        Sets the track's instrument using the instrument's MIDI value (0-127). Use the static final variables of the Instrument class as convenient parameters to this method.
        Parameters:
        instNum - the desired instrument number

      • getInstrument

        public Instrument getInstrument()
        Gets this track's instrument.
        Returns:
        the track's instrument

      • transpose

        public void transpose(int steps)
        Transposes all notes and chords in the track.
        Specified by:
        transpose in interface Playable
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of steps (positive or negative) to tranpose the track

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the track, including the number of elements, instrument, and the String representation of each element.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation of the track
